artefact: Expenses and benefits: food and groceries

artefact.alternative_title: Employers' tax and reporting for food and groceries
artefact.overview: Tax and reporting rules for employers providing food and groceries for employees
artefact.body:
As an employer, you might have to report and pay National Insurance on any food or groceries with no resale value that you give to employees or directors.

Reporting and paying

Who gets the benefit What to do What to pay
Employees earning at a rate of less than £8,500 a year No need to report Nothing
Employees earning at a rate of £8,500 or more a year P11D, section A Class 1A National Insurance on the cost to you
Directors P11D, section A Class 1A National Insurance on the cost to you
